intro: Hoya ubudensis, commonly known as the Ubud hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Hoya ubudensis is a climbing plant that thrives in humid, warm environments with indirect sunlight. It is popular among houseplants due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
